title: Batmobile supercar with mounted ‘machine gun’ could be yours for cool £686,000
text:
This replica Batmobile has gone on sale (Picture: CEN/@auto.ru)

A one-and-a-half tonne Batmobile replica is about to be auctioned, and the timing could not be better with the movie Joker hitting cinemas this week.

The supercar is a recreation of the one in the 2016 film Batman vs Superman and is only one of four made in the world.

Its asking price is a wallet-lightening £686,000.

What that gets you though is a 502 horsepower, V8-engine beast, complete with thermal imager and a mounted ‘machine gun’ on the bonnet.

The two-seater coupe was built in 2018 and currently has 74 miles on the clock. It has been put up for sale on the website avto.ru.

It features thermal imaging cameras and a mounted ‘machine gun’ (Picture: CEN/@auto.ru)

It has been upgraded to include automatic doors, armoured glass and a quick-detachable racing wheel (CEN/@auto.ru)

The mammoth monster measures six-metres long and four-metres wide which may make finding a parking spot in the UK tricky as the standard parking space as about half that size.

In fact the car is unsuitable for ordinary roads due to its sheer scale and can only be transported on special vehicles in urban areas – but it does come with a number of upgrades including automatic doors, armoured glass and a quick-detachable steering wheel, similar to racing cars.

According to the car’s current owner, Alisher Punk, there are only four such cars in the in the world, two in the UAE, one in the USA and this one, in Russia.

A previous Batmobile was sold on the website with an asking price £888,905.

The car will be kept at the Oscar Club car space in Moscow until it is sold.

Thermal imaging – one of the car’s features (Picture: CEN/@FastBoomPro Moscow)

The Batmobile has come a long way since the 1960s (Picture: Ollie Millington/Getty Images)
